text: The group that represent the colombian government in the negotiation with Pfizer did not how to speak in english
explanation: Pfizer denied the information

text: Rescuer from Rio de Janeiro dies because of Covid-19 vaccine
explanation: The man died of a myocardial infarction and had had no adverse reaction to the immunization he took, according to local health officials.

text: The Spanish Government is going to give 560 euros to those who test positive for coronavirus
explanation: It is a hoax that the Spanish Government has raised this measure, the content refers to the United Kingdom

text: 53 people have died in Gibraltar after receiving the vaccine against COVID-19
explanation: Gibraltar's chief minister, Fabi n Picardo, assures Maldita.es that it is "fake news" and the Gibraltar Health Authority assures that there is no evidence

text: Pfizer vaccination has stopped due to the death of up to 400 people in Norway.
explanation: At this stage, neither Norway, nor Pfizer has made such a decision. Norway continues the vaccination in accordance with the existing protocol. According to the data from the website of the Norwegian Institute of Public Health, there were only 104 cases of predictable side effects among more than 70,000 vaccinated people as of January 21. Official sources have no mention of 400 deaths after the vaccination.

text: Bilderberg group is planning depopulation by vaccines.
explanation: This video is not based on facts. The autors don't understand real actions of Bilderberg group, UN and WHO

text: Pfizer paused vaccine deliveries to Mexico due to omission of the federal government
explanation: It is true that the pharmaceutical company Pfizer stopped delivering vaccines against COVID-19 to Mexico, but it was not due to "dark circumstances", as they assured in social networks. In reality, the company made an adjustment in its production, and the distribution of its vaccines not only stopped for Mexico, but also for other countries.

text: The WHO has admitted that most positive PCR results are false, and that the pandemic was ƒ??fakeƒ?
explanation: The WHO published an information notice regarding PCR tests, but it does not say the test is inadequate. It states that some false positives can occur, which has never been denied, and recommends a set of practices to reduce the number of such occurances

text: A Peruvian court found Gates, Soros and Rockefeller guilty of producing SARS-CoV-2
explanation: There is no court ruling that the virus that causes COVID-19 in Peru was produced by human hands. An appeals court used these statements when explaining the delay of a case with a pandemic.

text: Man died because of Coronavac vaccine
explanation: The man had a heart attack that was not related to the vaccine

text: COVID-19 vaccine nullifies 2.79% of the population
explanation: The claim misinterprets a U.S. CDC report

text: A video shows that the first woman to be vaccined in Presidente Figueiredo did not receive an injection
explanation: First the woman received the injection, than they reenacted the scene for photographers. The original video, which shows both scenes, was deliberately edited to remove the actual injection

text: A nasal spray neutralizes Covid-19 in a minute.
explanation: There are no enough scientific data on the effect of the solution against coronavirus in humans. The data available on the product are at the level of animal trials.

text: The nanovaccine produced at home can cure the virus
explanation: The article shows false statements aboout the vaccine

text: Facebook posts claim the World Bank is giving loans to small businesses in Africa
explanation: The World Bank confirmed to AFP Fact Check that the posts emanated from fraudulent accounts linked to cybercrime attacks targeting the institution.

text: Atlanta baseball legend Hank Aaron's death linked to his Moderna Covid-19 vaccination,
explanation: But the vaccines have been tested for safety, and a medical examiner as well as Morehouse School of Medicine, where Aaron was vaccinated, said his death was unrelated to the immunization.

text: A video shows that German politician Roland Grillmeier faked his Covid-19 vaccination
explanation: Grillmeier did not fake the vaccination. The video shows him at a test run of a vaccination camp in November. Grillmeier claims he isn't vaccinated against Covid-19 yet.

text: Governor of Sao Paulo decrees isolation measures in the state and travels to the state of Rio de Janeiro the following weekend
explanation: Records show that the governor attended an event in the state of Sao Paulo over the weekend.

text: Joe Biden said chloroquine is effective against Covid-19
explanation: In fact, Biden has already taken a stand against the drug and said that no serious doctor would prescribe it.

text: Brazilian ex-president Lula's son bought 20% of the shares of Sinovac Biotech
explanation: His or any brazilian name don't appear among the shareholders of the company that developed the CoronaVac vaccine

text: The WHO has admitted that  COVID-19 test results grossly exceeded the number of infected people
explanation: The information notice published by the World Health Organization on January 20, did not state that PCR test results exceed the number of infected people. The notice actually summarizes recommendations to consider in PCR testing and diagnosing of coronavirus. In the information notice, medical personnel are recommended to consider the patient's clinical presentations, contact with confirmed cases, and other factors together with PCR test results when diagnosing coronavirus. As for the lab technicians, they should carefully read the user's manual for PCR tests.

text: WHO announced that PCR tests give false positive results immediately after Biden took the office.
explanation: The WHO document is an information note, not a statement, reminding laboratory staff to carefully read the user manuals that come with the tests. The note does not contain information that PCR tests are more likely to give false positive results.

text: An image that shows that the vice president of Argentina, Cristina Fern ndez de Kirchner, was vaccinated by a fake nurse named M ximo Estavez
explanation: The Vice President received the first dose of Sputnik V and the one who applied it was the Vice Minister of Health of the Province of Buenos Aires, Nicol s Kreplak. Kreplak is a clinician, sanitarista and he administered the vaccine at the Hospital Presidente PerÇün de Avellaneda.

text: Pfizer / BioNTech vaccine less effective than expected
explanation: It is expected that the first dose of the vaccine offers 50 percent protection. Pfizer / BioNTech vaccine announced the first dose efficacy as 52 percent in the trial results.

text: A chain that circulates on WhatsApp that indicates that the Province of Buenos Aires (Argentina) is looking for volunteers for the vaccination campaign
explanation: A message is circulating that summons volunteers to join the Buenos Aires Province vaccination plan in exchange for a remuneration of $ 32 thousand, but it is false. The Buenos Aires Ministry of Health denied the viral chain and pointed out that the volunteer campaign that they promote for the second stage of the "Buenos Aires Vacunate" plan is solidarity and unpaid. In addition, the Ministry indicates that volunteers should not complete the Google form that accompanies the viral text and, through which, personal data is requested, since it is a misinformation.

text: Masks have negative impacts on 68% of children.
explanation: A project in Germany gave a self-selected group of parents a chance to report children's negative reactions to wearing masks using subjective criteria to describe their childrens' reactions.

text: An image say that the plan of Bill Gates with the pandemic is introduce a chip through covid vaccines
explanation: The image is false because it confuses the concept of digital certificate to cast doubt on the vaccines

text: Lula's son, Fabio Lula da Silva, and Joao Doria, governor of Sao Paulo, conspired to buy stocks from Sinovac. Nowadays, Lula's son owns 20% of the company
explanation: Sinovac stocks are frozen since February 2019. None of their major stockholders are Brazilian

text: Pfizer tested an antibiotic on minors in Nigeria leaving about 200 people dead
explanation: In 1996, when Nigeria was hit by meningitis epidemic, a hundred children were given an experimental oral antibiotic Trovan developed by Pfizer, while a further hundred received ceftriaxone, the ƒ??gold-standardƒ? treatment of modern medicine. Five children died after taking Trovan and six ƒ?? after taking ceftriaxone. But later it was claimed that Pfizer did not have proper consent from parents to use an experimental drug on their children and questions were raised over the documentation of the trial. Legal action filed against the company alleged that some received a dose lower than recommended, leaving many children with brain damage, paralysis or slurred speech. Pfizer had argued that meningitis and not its antibiotic had led to the deaths of 11 children. Ultimately, following a 15-year court dispute, Pfizer paid out USD 175,000 to the families of four of the children each.

text: ƒ??Ivermectin is a drug that can eliminate the coronavirus in 48 hoursƒ?
explanation: Ivermectin was only tested in cell cultures where it was shown to be effective against SARS-CoV-2 when used in concentrations higher than those approved for use in humans; unregulated use is highly toxic.

text: Actor Fernanda Torres said she hoped that COVID-19 helped eliminate Bolsonaro's supporters
explanation: She wrote a text criticizing the federal government's lack of actions against COVID-19 and Bolsonaro's supporters denial of the pandemic, but she did not say she hoped they died

text: Covid-19 vaccines alter the genetic code and can cause cancer
explanation: According to health authorities, virologists and oncologists, the interaction with the genetic material in these immunizations is minimal and restricted to the action against the coronavirus in the body, with no capacity to cause mutations or cancer.

text: Luciano Hang, Bolsonaro's militant businessman, donated 200 oxygen cylinders to the state of Amazonas
explanation: As of the date of publication, the businessman hadn't made any donations, as his adviser informed Aos Fatos.

text: The COVID-19 antigen tests in this image come prepared to test positive or negative
explanation: These are antigen test control swabs and are used to check if the test reagents are working properly

text: The UN publishes the list of countries that have purchased COVID vaccines from the different laboratories when, when and from whom they bought, MEXICO is not on that list
explanation: It¶ïs false that the agency has published such information, and Mexico does appear in the list of countries that will receive doses from the COVAX initiative

text: WHO Has Ranked Sri Lanka Fifth Best Country For Covid-19 Response
explanation: The World Health Organization hasn't ranked Sri Lanka fifth best country for Covid-19 response'. Fake post is going viral on social media.

text: A woman died in few seconds after taking COVID vaccine
explanation: The woman who fainted after taking the jab is alive.

text: WHO now saying you do not need to wear a mask.
explanation: WHO recommends people wear masks to protect against COVID-19.

text: Ecuador find the cure for coronavirus
explanation: The message is false because Ecuador have not find the cure.

text: Clinical trials in Indonesia recorded Sinovac's COVID-19 vaccine as having a 91.25% efficacy rate.
explanation: Interim data from the Phase III trials of the Sinovac vaccine in Indonesia showed an efficacy rate of 65.3%. It was a Phase III trial in Turkey that tallied a 91.25% efficacy rate.

text: Pfeizer denied that the group representing the Colombian government in the negotiation with Pfeizer did not know how to speak English.
explanation: Pfizer denied the information

text: The rescuer from Rio de Janeiro rumored to have died because of the COVID-19 vaccine actually died of a myocardial infarction.
explanation: The man died of a myocardial infarction and had had no adverse reaction to the immunization he took, according to local health officials.

text: 560 euros will be given to people who test positive for COVID-19 in the United Kingdom, not in Spain.
explanation: It is a hoax that the Spanish Government has raised this measure, the content refers to the United Kingdom

text: The rumor that 53 people have died in Gibraltar after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine is "fake news" according to Gibraltar's Chief Minister and the Gibraltar Health Authority.
explanation: Gibraltar's chief minister, Fabi n Picardo, assures Maldita.es that it is "fake news" and the Gibraltar Health Authority assures that there is no evidence

text: Norway has not stopped Pfeizer vaccination because according to the Norwegian Institute of Public Health, there were only 104 cases of predictable side effects among more than 70,000 vaccinated people as of January 21st, and no official sources confirm the rumor that there have been 400 deaths.
explanation: At this stage, neither Norway, nor Pfizer has made such a decision. Norway continues the vaccination in accordance with the existing protocol. According to the data from the website of the Norwegian Institute of Public Health, there were only 104 cases of predictable side effects among more than 70,000 vaccinated people as of January 21. Official sources have no mention of 400 deaths after the vaccination.

text: The Bildenberg group is not planning depopulation by vaccines, the rumors stating that were started by people who do not understand the actions of the Bildenberg group, the UN or the WHO.
explanation: This video is not based on facts. The autors don't understand real actions of Bilderberg group, UN and WHO

text: Pfeizer stopped delivering vaccines to Mexico not due to the omission of the Federal Government or because of "dark circumstances", but due to an adjustment in the production fo the COVID-19 vaccine that affected multiple countries.
explanation: It is true that the pharmaceutical company Pfizer stopped delivering vaccines against COVID-19 to Mexico, but it was not due to "dark circumstances", as they assured in social networks. In reality, the company made an adjustment in its production, and the distribution of its vaccines not only stopped for Mexico, but also for other countries.

text: Most positive PCR results are not aflse and the pandemic is not "fake", the WHO only published an information notice stating that some positive results may be false and recommending a set of practices to reduce the number of false positive results.
explanation: The WHO published an information notice regarding PCR tests, but it does not say the test is inadequate. It states that some false positives can occur, which has never been denied, and recommends a set of practices to reduce the number of such occurances

text: The rumor that a Peruvian court found Gates, Soros and Rockefeller guilty of producing SARS-CoV-2 is false, the truth is that an Appeals Court in Peru used the rumor as an excuse for the delay of a ruling on case during the pandemic.
explanation: There is no court ruling that the virus that causes COVID-19 in Peru was produced by human hands. An appeals court used these statements when explaining the delay of a case with a pandemic.

text: The man rumored to have died because of the Coronavac vaccine actually had a heart attack that was unrelated to the vaccine.
explanation: The man had a heart attack that was not related to the vaccine

text: The claim that the COVID-19 vaccine "nullifies" 2.79% of the population is false and a misinterpretation of a U.S. CDC report.
explanation: The claim misinterprets a U.S. CDC report

text: The first woman to be vaccinated in Presidente Figueiredo received the vaccine and then she and the medical specialists reenacted the scene for photographers, resulting in a video with both scenes that later got edited to only show the reenactment.
explanation: First the woman received the injection, than they reenacted the scene for photographers. The original video, which shows both scenes, was deliberately edited to remove the actual injection

text: There is currently no nasal spray for human use that neutralizes COVID-19 in a minute, the avalible data on the product comes from pre-clinical trials on animals and there is not enough information about its effects on humans.
explanation: There are no enough scientific data on the effect of the solution against coronavirus in humans. The data available on the product are at the level of animal trials.

text: The article that claims "nanovaccine producesd at home can cure the virus" makes false statements about the vaccine.
explanation: The article shows false statements aboout the vaccine

text: Fraudulent Facebook accounts linked to cybercrime attacks targeting the World Bank made posts falsely claiming that the World Bank is giving loans to small businesses in Africa, confirmed the World Bank for AFP Fact Check.
explanation: The World Bank confirmed to AFP Fact Check that the posts emanated from fraudulent accounts linked to cybercrime attacks targeting the institution.

text: The rumor that Atlanta baseball legend Hank Aaron's death was linked to his Moderna COVID-19 vaccinations is untrue, his medical examiner and the Morehouse School of Medicine where Aaron was vaccinated stating that his death was unrelated to the vaccine.
explanation: But the vaccines have been tested for safety, and a medical examiner as well as Morehouse School of Medicine, where Aaron was vaccinated, said his death was unrelated to the immunization.

text: Roland Grillmeier, a German politician, filmed a test run of a vaccination camp in November and claims he isn't vaccinated yet, the video claiming that he "faked" the vaccination being a misinterpretation of the facts.
explanation: Grillmeier did not fake the vaccination. The video shows him at a test run of a vaccination camp in November. Grillmeier claims he isn't vaccinated against Covid-19 yet.

text: The claims that the governor of Sao Paulo decreed isolation measures in the state and travelled to the state of Rio de Janeiro the following weekend are false, records show that he attended an event in the state of Sao Paulo over the weekend.
explanation: Records show that the governor attended an event in the state of Sao Paulo over the weekend.

text: The rumor that Joe Biden said that chloroquine is effective against COVID-19 is false, and Biden has in fact taken a stand against the drug and said that no serious doctor would prescribe it.
explanation: In fact, Biden has already taken a stand against the drug and said that no serious doctor would prescribe it.

text: The rumor that Brazilian ex-president Lula's son bought 20% of the shares of Sinovac Biotech is false, and neither his nor any Brazillian name appears among the shareholders of the company that developed the CoronaVac vaccine.
explanation: His or any brazilian name don't appear among the shareholders of the company that developed the CoronaVac vaccine

text: The WHO has not stated that COVID-19 test results grossly exceeded the number of infected people,  the WHO only published an information notice stating that some positive results may be false and recommending a set of practices to reduce the number of false positive results.
explanation: The information notice published by the World Health Organization on January 20, did not state that PCR test results exceed the number of infected people. The notice actually summarizes recommendations to consider in PCR testing and diagnosing of coronavirus. In the information notice, medical personnel are recommended to consider the patient's clinical presentations, contact with confirmed cases, and other factors together with PCR test results when diagnosing coronavirus. As for the lab technicians, they should carefully read the user's manual for PCR tests.

text: The WHO has not announced that PCR tests give false positive results immediately after Biden took the office, it released an information note reminding laboratory staff to carefully read the user manuals that come with the tests.
explanation: The WHO document is an information note, not a statement, reminding laboratory staff to carefully read the user manuals that come with the tests. The note does not contain information that PCR tests are more likely to give false positive results.

text: The image that shows that the vice president of Argentina, Cristina Fern ndez de Kirchner, was vaccinated by a fake nurse named M ximo Estavez is incorrect, the Vice President having received the first dose of Sputnik V administered by the Vice Minister of Health of the Province of Buenos Aires, Nicol s Kreplak, a clinician.
explanation: The Vice President received the first dose of Sputnik V and the one who applied it was the Vice Minister of Health of the Province of Buenos Aires, Nicol s Kreplak. Kreplak is a clinician, sanitarista and he administered the vaccine at the Hospital Presidente PerÇün de Avellaneda.

text: The rumor that the Pfizer / BioNTech vaccine less effective than expected is untrue, the expected protection for the first vaccine dose being 50 percent and the efficacy announced by Pfizer / BioNTech being 52 percent.
explanation: It is expected that the first dose of the vaccine offers 50 percent protection. Pfizer / BioNTech vaccine announced the first dose efficacy as 52 percent in the trial results.

text: A message chain that circulates on WhatsApp indicating that the Province of Buenos Aires (Argentina) is looking for volunteers for the vaccination campaign and is willing to pay $ 32 thousand is false, the Buenos Aires Ministry of Health stating that the vaccination campaign is unpaid and based on solidarity, and advising people not to complete the Google Forms accompanying the text or send on the text.
explanation: A message is circulating that summons volunteers to join the Buenos Aires Province vaccination plan in exchange for a remuneration of $ 32 thousand, but it is false. The Buenos Aires Ministry of Health denied the viral chain and pointed out that the volunteer campaign that they promote for the second stage of the "Buenos Aires Vacunate" plan is solidarity and unpaid. In addition, the Ministry indicates that volunteers should not complete the Google form that accompanies the viral text and, through which, personal data is requested, since it is a misinformation.

text: The claim that masks have negative impacts on 68% of children comes from a project in Germany using a self-selected group of parents who reported their children's negative reactions to wearing masks using subjective criteria, skewing the results and making the findings non-applicable to the general population.
explanation: A project in Germany gave a self-selected group of parents a chance to report children's negative reactions to wearing masks using subjective criteria to describe their childrens' reactions.

text: The image that says  Bill Gates' plan regarding the pandemic is to introduce a chip through COVID-19 vaccines is false and misunderstands the concept of digital certificates.
explanation: The image is false because it confuses the concept of digital certificate to cast doubt on the vaccines

text: The rumor that Lula's son, Fabio Lula da Silva, and Joao Doria, governor of Sao Paulo, conspired to buy stocks from Sinovac and that Lula's son currently owns 20% of the company is false, because Sinovac stocks have been frozen since February 2019 and none of the shareholders are Brazillian.
explanation: Sinovac stocks are frozen since February 2019. None of their major stockholders are Brazilian

text: In 1996 Pfizer tested an experimental antibiotic (Trovan) in parallel to ceftriaxone (gold standard) on a hundred minors each in Nigeria, and there were reported five deaths in the Trovan group and six in the cefrtiaxone one, not "two hundred deaths". The parents' informed consent and the suitability of the dosage (allegedly too low) has been called into question and after a 15-year court dispute, Pfizer paid out USD 175,000 to the families of four of the children each.
explanation: In 1996, when Nigeria was hit by meningitis epidemic, a hundred children were given an experimental oral antibiotic Trovan developed by Pfizer, while a further hundred received ceftriaxone, the ƒ??gold-standardƒ? treatment of modern medicine. Five children died after taking Trovan and six ƒ?? after taking ceftriaxone. But later it was claimed that Pfizer did not have proper consent from parents to use an experimental drug on their children and questions were raised over the documentation of the trial. Legal action filed against the company alleged that some received a dose lower than recommended, leaving many children with brain damage, paralysis or slurred speech. Pfizer had argued that meningitis and not its antibiotic had led to the deaths of 11 children. Ultimately, following a 15-year court dispute, Pfizer paid out USD 175,000 to the families of four of the children each.

text: The claim that ivermectin is a drug that can eliminate the coronavirus in 48 hours is very misleading, because ivermectin has proven effective against SARS-CoV-2 only used on cell cultures in much higher concentrations than the ones approved for human, and unregulated use can be highly toxic.
explanation: Ivermectin was only tested in cell cultures where it was shown to be effective against SARS-CoV-2 when used in concentrations higher than those approved for use in humans; unregulated use is highly toxic.

text: Actor Fernanda Torres did not say that she hoped that COVID-19 helped eliminate Bolsonaro's supporters, she wrote a text criticizing the federal government's lack of actions against COVID-19 and Bolsonaro's supporters denial of the pandemic.
explanation: She wrote a text criticizing the federal government's lack of actions against COVID-19 and Bolsonaro's supporters denial of the pandemic, but she did not say she hoped they died

text: The rumor that Covid-19 vaccines alter the genetic code and can cause cancer is false: according to health authorities, virologists and oncologists, the interaction with the genetic material in these immunizations is minimal and restricted to the action against the coronavirus in the body, with no capacity to cause mutations or cancer.
explanation: According to health authorities, virologists and oncologists, the interaction with the genetic material in these immunizations is minimal and restricted to the action against the coronavirus in the body, with no capacity to cause mutations or cancer.

text: The rumor that Luciano Hang, Bolsonaro's militant businessman, donated 200 oxygen cylinders to the state of Amazonas is false: as of the date of publication, the businessman hadn't made any donations, as his adviser informed Aos Fatos.
explanation: As of the date of publication, the businessman hadn't made any donations, as his adviser informed Aos Fatos.

text: The COVID-19 antigen tests do not come prepared to test positive or negative, the antigen test control swabs are used to check if the test reagents are working properly.
explanation: These are antigen test control swabs and are used to check if the test reagents are working properly

text: The rumor that the UN publishes the list of countries that have purchased COVID vaccines from the different laboratories when, when and from whom they bought,  and that MEXICO is not on that list, is false; the agency has not published such lists and Mexico does appear on the list of countries that will receive doses from the COVAX initiative.
explanation: It¶ïs false that the agency has published such information, and Mexico does appear in the list of countries that will receive doses from the COVAX initiative

text: The rumor that the WHO Has Ranked Sri Lanka Fifth Best Country For Covid-19 Response is false and originates from a fake post that is going viral on social media.
explanation: The World Health Organization hasn't ranked Sri Lanka fifth best country for Covid-19 response'. Fake post is going viral on social media.

text: The rumor that a woman died in few seconds after taking COVID vaccine is false, the woman is alive and simply fainted after taking the jab.
explanation: The woman who fainted after taking the jab is alive.

text: The claim that the WHO is now saying you do not need to wear a mask is false, the WHO recommends wearing a mask to protect against COVID-19.
explanation: WHO recommends people wear masks to protect against COVID-19.

text: The message that Ecuador found the cure for coronavirus is false.
explanation: The message is false because Ecuador have not find the cure.

text: The claim that clinical trials in Indonesia recorded Sinovac's COVID-19 vaccine as having a 91.25% efficacy rate is false, the efficacy rate in Indonesia is 65.3% and in Turkey is 91.25% for Phase III trials.
explanation: Interim data from the Phase III trials of the Sinovac vaccine in Indonesia showed an efficacy rate of 65.3%. It was a Phase III trial in Turkey that tallied a 91.25% efficacy rate.
